Question
========

The distribution of the number of children per family in the U.S. has a mean of 0.9 and a standard deviation of 1.1. If you take a random sample of 20 families in the U.S., what is the probability that there are a total of 15 or more children in the sample? (z is normally distributed by default).

Answerlist
----------

* P(z ≤ 0.86)
* P(z ≤ -0.86)
* 1- P(z ≥ -0.86)
* 1- P((z ≤ -0.86)
* 1- P(z ≤ 15)

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* P(z ≤ 0.86): Incorrect
* P(z ≤ -0.86): Incorrect
* 1- P(z ≥ -0.86): Incorrect
* 1- P((z ≤ -0.86): Correct
* 1- P (z ≤ 15): Incorrect
